title: Absolute direction of bias/indirectness
text: first step adjustment calculate absolute direction bias/indirectness. helpful way understand . plotted standard forest plot. Note red arrows show absolute direction bias, direction adjustment.  additive bias/indirectness, position point estimate effect absolute direction bias. , regardless whether point estimate null, absolute direction bias/indirectness . contrast, proportional bias/indirectness, absolute direction bias depends position effect estimate. two scenarios consider:

title: Absolute direction of bias/indirectness
text: effect estimate null, bias towards null adjusted moving effect estimate proportionally left. Conversely, bias away null adjusted moving point estimate proportionally right.

what: Point estimate above NULL - Bias towards the NULL
title: Absolute direction of bias/indirectness
text: contrast, effect estimate null, bias towards null adjusted moving effect estimate proportionally left. Conversely, bias away null adjusted moving point estimate proportionally right. example, effect estimate represents protective effect (null), bias towards null adjusted moving effect estimate proportionally right. contrast, effect intervention harmful (effect estimate null), bias towards null adjusted moving effect estimate proportionally left.

title: Absolute direction of bias/indirectness
text: absolute direction also used defining sign prior tri_append_*() functions. bias/indirectness expected pull effect right (absolute direction = right), given positive sign. tri_calculate_adjusted_estimates(), subtracting total additive bias effect estimate yiy_i. correct absolute direction right, want sign prior positive (e.g. N(0.9, 0.5)), subtracted effect estimate, overall impact negative (shift effect estimate left): yi−(0.6)y_i - (0.6) = yi−0.6y_i - 0.6 Conversely, assessment absolute direction bias left, want sign bias correction negative (e.g. N(-0.9, 0.5)), shifting effect estimate right: yi−(−0.6)y_i - (-0.6) = yi+0.6y_i + 0.6 See Section 6.1 Turner et al. derivation equations.

title: Absolute direction of bias/indirectness
text: illustrate ensure code working correctly, lets consider simple dataset 6 studies, study fulfilling one scenarios described .
code: # Create the example dataset example_data <- tibble(   study = paste("Study", 1:6),   yi = c(-.2,.25, -.1,-.3,.1,.3),   vi = round(runif(6, -.05,.05),3),    d1j = rep("moderate", 6),   d1t = c(rep("add",2),rep("prop",4)),   d1d = c("Favours comparator", "Favours experimental",         "Away from null", "Towards null",         "Away from null", "Towards null")   )  # Complete the preparation steps of triangulate example_data_prepped <- example_data %>%   tri_to_long() %>%   tri_absolute_direction() %>%   tri_append_bias(dat_bias_values)

what: Additive - Favours comparator - right - positive sign
title: Absolute direction of bias/indirectness
code: example_data[1,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   study      yi     vi d1j      d1t   d1d                #>   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>    <chr> <chr>              #> 1 Study 1  -0.2 -0.042 moderate add   Favours comparator example_data_prepped[1,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   study     yi     vi domain j     t     d     bias_m_add bias_v_add bias_m_prop #>   <chr>  <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 Study…  -0.2 -0.042 d1     mode… add   right       0.09       0.05           0 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: bias_v_prop <dbl>

what: Additive - Favours intervention - left - negative sign
title: Absolute direction of bias/indirectness
code: example_data[2,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   study      yi    vi d1j      d1t   d1d                  #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>    <chr> <chr>                #> 1 Study 2  0.25 0.033 moderate add   Favours experimental example_data_prepped[2,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   study      yi    vi domain j     t     d     bias_m_add bias_v_add bias_m_prop #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 Study 2  0.25 0.033 d1     mode… add   left       -0.09       0.05           0 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: bias_v_prop <dbl>

what: Proportional - Point estimate above NULL - Towards the NULL - left - negative sign
title: Absolute direction of bias/indirectness
code: example_data[3,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   study      yi    vi d1j      d1t   d1d            #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>    <chr> <chr>          #> 1 Study 3  -0.1  0.01 moderate prop  Away from null example_data_prepped[3,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   study      yi    vi domain j     t     d     bias_m_add bias_v_add bias_m_prop #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 Study 3  -0.1  0.01 d1     mode… prop  left           0          0       -0.03 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: bias_v_prop <dbl>

what: Proportional - Point estimate below NULL - Away from NULL - right - positive sign
title: Absolute direction of bias/indirectness
code: example_data[4,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   study      yi     vi d1j      d1t   d1d          #>   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>    <chr> <chr>        #> 1 Study 4  -0.3 -0.034 moderate prop  Towards null example_data_prepped[4,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   study     yi     vi domain j     t     d     bias_m_add bias_v_add bias_m_prop #>   <chr>  <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 Study…  -0.3 -0.034 d1     mode… prop  right          0          0        0.03 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: bias_v_prop <dbl>

what: Proportional - Point estimate below NULL - Towards the NULL - right - positive sign
title: Absolute direction of bias/indirectness
code: example_data[5,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   study      yi     vi d1j      d1t   d1d            #>   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>    <chr> <chr>          #> 1 Study 5   0.1 -0.049 moderate prop  Away from null example_data_prepped[5,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   study     yi     vi domain j     t     d     bias_m_add bias_v_add bias_m_prop #>   <chr>  <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 Study…   0.1 -0.049 d1     mode… prop  right          0          0        0.03 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: bias_v_prop <dbl>

what: Proportional - Point estimate below NULL - Away from NULL - left - negative sign
title: Absolute direction of bias/indirectness
code: example_data[6,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   study      yi     vi d1j      d1t   d1d          #>   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>    <chr> <chr>        #> 1 Study 6   0.3 -0.003 moderate prop  Towards null example_data_prepped[6,] #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   study      yi    vi domain j     t     d     bias_m_add bias_v_add bias_m_prop #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 Study 6   0.3 -3e-3 d1     mode… prop  left           0          0       -0.03 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: bias_v_prop <dbl>

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal triangulate create generalised version bias-adjusted meta-analysis approach originally proposed Turner et al.  number steps process: Define causal question interest Identify relevant evidence sources standardise effect directions Specify idealised version study Assess extent direction bias/indirectness result Define modifying terms bias indirectness result Calculate bias-/indirectness-adjusted results perform meta-analysis package deals steps 5 6.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: WARNING #1: package development, API subject change point without warning. WARNING #2: approach described requires work preparation data work package. Please sure read documentation make use helper functions check whether data set-right. WARNING #3: approach described requires careful choice valid prior distributions bias/indirectness.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: approach described details create datasets, see Creating triangulation datasets vignette (construction). load data, helper functions convert long format convert absolute directions bias/indirectness. apply approach indirectness dataset:
code: # Load libraries library(magrittr) library(triangulate)  # See column names of dat_bias  colnames(dat_bias) #>  [1] "result_id" "study"     "type"      "yi"        "vi"        "d1j"       #>  [7] "d1t"       "d1d"       "d2j"       "d2t"       "d2d"       "d3j"       #> [13] "d3t"       "d3d"       "d4j"       "d4t"       "d4d"       "d5j"       #> [19] "d5t"       "d5d"       "d6j"       "d6t"       "d6d"       "d7j"       #> [25] "d7t"       "d7d"  head(dat_bias) #>   result_id   study type          yi         vi      d1j d1t #> 1   13401-2 Study 1 NRSI -0.12783337 0.12506586     High Add #> 2   14632-2 Study 2 NRSI -0.19845094 0.08680919 Moderate Add #> 3   14658-2 Study 3 NRSI -0.18632958 0.03361240     High Add #> 4   14665-6 Study 4 NRSI  0.19062036 0.05526578     High Add #> 5   14720-1 Study 5 NRSI -0.56211892 0.05141924     High Add #> 6   14761-1 Study 6 NRSI -0.09431068 0.06969822     High Add #>                    d1d      d2j  d2t                d2d      d3j  d3t #> 1   Favours comparator      Low None               None Moderate Prop #> 2 Favours experimental Moderate  Add Favours comparator      Low None #> 3   Favours comparator     High  Add Favours comparator      Low None #> 4   Favours comparator Moderate  Add      Unpredictable      Low None #> 5   Favours comparator      Low None               None      Low None #> 6   Favours comparator Moderate  Add Favours comparator      Low None #>             d3d d4j  d4t  d4d      d5j  d5t           d5d      d6j  d6t #> 1 Unpredictable Low None None      Low None          None      Low None #> 2          None Low None None      Low None          None Moderate  Add #> 3          None Low None None      Low None          None Moderate  Add #> 4          None Low None None      Low None          None      Low None #> 5          None Low None None Moderate Prop Unpredictable      Low None #> 6          None Low None None Moderate Prop Unpredictable      Low None #>             d6d      d7j  d7t            d7d #> 1          None Moderate Prop Away from null #> 2 Unpredictable Moderate Prop Away from null #> 3 Unpredictable Moderate Prop Away from null #> 4          None Moderate Prop Away from null #> 5          None Moderate Prop Away from null #> 6          None Moderate Prop Away from null  tri_dat_check(dat_bias) #> Looks good! #> All expected columns are present in the dataset. dat_bias <- triangulate::dat_bias %>%  # Convert to long format tri_to_long() %>%    tri_absolute_direction() %>%  tri_append_bias(triangulate::dat_bias_values) dat_ind <- triangulate::dat_ind %>% # Convert to long format tri_to_long() %>% tri_absolute_direction() %>% tri_append_indirect(triangulate::dat_ind_values)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: dat_bias_values #>   domain        j bias_m_add bias_v_add bias_m_prop bias_v_prop #> 1    all     high       0.18       0.10        0.06       0.032 #> 2    all moderate       0.09       0.05        0.03       0.016 #> 3    all      low       0.00       0.00        0.00       0.000

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: now two clean datasets, one bias one indirectness, can use point, unadjusted (yi, vi) adjusted (yi_adj, vi_adj) estimates result. estimates can simply passed metafor analysis
code: dat_final <- tri_prep_data(dat_bias, dat_ind) #> Joining with `by = join_by(result_id)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(result_id)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(result_id)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(result_id)` model <- metafor::rma(   yi = yi,   vi = vi,   data = dat_final,   slab = dat_final$study,   method = 'DL' )  # Pass model to forest plot function metafor::forest(   model,   atransf = exp, ) model_adj <- metafor::rma(   yi = yi_adj,   vi = vi_adj,   data = dat_final,   slab = dat_final$study,   method = 'DL' )  # Pass model to forest plot function metafor::forest(   model_adj,   atransf = exp )
